description: From French mulâtresse, feminine of mulâtre.

entries.meaning: (dated, now offensive) A female mulatto, a mulatta; a woman with one black and one white parent.
examples: I believe his final choice was determined less by personal preference than by compassion: it was a beautiful but modest-looking mulattress who stood in the background, protruding a pair of superb pear-shaped breasts, with her hands clasped behind her head and eyes raised soulfully to the ceiling.
